name: KOI-12
scenarioDescription:
The KOI-12 Exoplanetary System


Overview

KOI-12 is a star with 1.5 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.4 times its radius. It is located 1317.6376244 light years away from the solar system.

KOI-12 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the KOI-12 system

KOI-12 b

KOI-12 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the Transit method. The mass of KOI-12 b is 349.613 times the mass of Earth. The radius of KOI-12 b is 13.787 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, KOI-12 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, KOI-12 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


KOI-12 c

KOI-12 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the Transit Timing Variations method. The mass of KOI-12 c is 6992.26 times the mass of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, KOI-12 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, KOI-12 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system KOI-12, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
